member.name: T:Xamarin.Essentials.SecureStorage
member.summary: Provides simple secure storage for key/value pairs.

remarks.para: Each platform uses the platform provided native API's for storing data securely:

item.term: iOS: Data is stored in KeyChain. Additional information on SecAccessible at:
Android: Encryption keys are stored in KeyStore and encrypted data is stored in a named shared preference container (PackageId.Xamarin.Essentials).
UWP: Data is encrypted with DataProtectionProvider and stored in a named ApplicationDataContainer (with a container name of ApplicationId.Xamarin.Essentials).

remarks.para: NOTE: On Android devices running below API 23 (6.0 Marshmallow) there is no AES available in KeyStore. As a best practice this API will generate an RSA/ECB/PKCS7Padding key pair stored in KeyStore (the only type supported in KeyStore by these lower API levels), which is used to wrap an AES key generated at runtime. This wrapped key is stored in Preferences.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Essentials.SecureStorage.DefaultAccessible
member.summary: iOS: Default SecAccessible to use for all Get/Set calls to KeyChain. Default value is AfterFirstUnlock.
member.value: The SecAccessible to use for all KeyChain access.

member.summary: Gets the decrypted value for a given Key.

member.summary: Removes the encrypted key/value pair for the given key.
member.returns: Returns true if the key value pair was removed.

member.summary: Removes all of the stored encrypted key/value pairs.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Essentials.Vibration
member.summary: Provides an easy way to make the device vibrate.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Essentials.Vibration.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel any current vibrations.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Essentials.Vibration.Vibrate
member.summary: Vibrate the device fo 500ms.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Essentials.Vibration.Vibrate(System.Double)
member.param: The number of milliseconds to vibrate for.
member.summary: Vibrate the device for the specified number of milliseconds in the range [0, 5000].
member.remarks: On iOS, the device will only vibrate for 500ms, regardless of the value specified.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Essentials.Vibration.Vibrate(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Vibrate the device for the specified time in the range [0, 5000]ms.
member.remarks: On iOS, the device will only vibrate for 500ms, regardless of the value specified.
